canDo: I can compare things and people using comparative and superlative forms.

rules.title: Comparative: -er / more + adjective
rules.explanation: Use -er for short adjectives (1-2 syllables) and 'more' for longer adjectives. Add 'than' after.
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.
He runs faster than his brother.
rules.koreanTip: 짧은 형용사는 -er을 붙이고, 긴 형용사는 앞에 'more'를 붙여요. 비교 대상 앞에는 'than'을 써요.

rules.title: Superlative: -est / most + adjective
rules.explanation: Use -est for short adjectives and 'most' for longer adjectives. Use 'the' before the superlative.
examples: He is the tallest in the class.
This is the most expensive car.

rules.title: Irregular comparatives and superlatives
rules.explanation: Some adjectives have irregular forms: good-better-best, bad-worse-worst, far-farther-farthest.
examples: This pizza is better than that one.
Today is the worst day ever.
The farthest I've traveled is Japan.

exercises.question: Seoul is ___ than Busan. (big)
exercises.explanation: 'Big' is a short adjective. Add -ger (double the consonant) for comparative.
exercises.koreanTip: 'big'은 짧은 형용사라 -er을 붙여요. 자음+모음+자음이면 자음을 한 번 더 쓰고 -er을 붙여요.

exercises.question: This movie is ___ than the last one. (interesting)
exercises.explanation: 'Interesting' is a long adjective (3+ syllables). Use 'more' for comparative.

exercises.question: She is ___ student in our school. (good)
exercises.explanation: 'Good' is irregular. The superlative is 'the best'.

exercises.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: She is more tall than me.
She is most tall in class.
She is the taller in class.
exercises.explanation: 'Tall' is a short adjective, so use 'taller than', not 'more tall'.

examples: These two shirts are similar in color.
This is different from what I expected.

words.koreanTip: 'the same as'로 '~와 같다'를 표현해요. 'same' 앞에는 항상 'the'를 써요.
'prefer A to B'로 'B보다 A를 선호하다'를 표현해요

examples: The advantage of this phone is its long battery life.

reading.title: City Life vs. Country Life
reading.passage: Many people wonder whether city life or country life is better. Cities are usually more exciting than rural areas. There are more restaurants, theaters, and shopping centers. Public transportation is also more convenient. However, cities are noisier and more polluted than the countryside. Country life is quieter and more peaceful. The air is cleaner, and there is more nature to enjoy. Houses are also cheaper in rural areas than in big cities. On the other hand, there are fewer job opportunities in the country. Both lifestyles have advantages and disadvantages. The best choice depends on what is most important to you.

questions.question: According to the passage, what is an advantage of city life?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'more restaurants, theaters, and shopping centers' in cities.

questions.question: What is a disadvantage of country life mentioned in the passage?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'there are fewer job opportunities in the country.'

questions.question: What does 'rural' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Rural' means relating to or characteristic of the countryside.

listening.title: Choosing a Restaurant
listening.script: Hey, should we go to the Italian restaurant or the Korean one? Well, the Italian place is closer, but the Korean restaurant has better reviews. The Korean restaurant is more expensive though. That's true, but the food there is more delicious. I agree. Also, the Italian restaurant is smaller, so it might be too crowded. Good point. Let's go to the Korean restaurant then. It's a bit farther, but it seems like the better choice. Sounds good to me!

exercises.question: Which restaurant is closer?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'the Italian place is closer'.

exercises.question: The Korean restaurant has ___ reviews.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'the Korean restaurant has better reviews'.

template.prompt: Compare two things using the template.
template.template: [ITEM1] is [COMPARATIVE1] than [ITEM2]. However, [ITEM2] is [COMPARATIVE2]. The [SUPERLATIVE] thing about [ITEM1] is [FEATURE]. Overall, I prefer [PREFERENCE] because [REASON].
template.correctExample: iPhones are more expensive than Samsung phones. However, Samsung phones have more customization options. The best thing about iPhones is the smooth user experience. Overall, I prefer iPhones because they are easier to use.

free.prompt: Compare two cities or countries you know. Use at least 3 comparative and 2 superlative forms.

checklist.item: State your preference with a reason

shadowing.sentence: This restaurant is more expensive than that one, but the food is better and the service is the best in the city.
shadowing.pronunciation: /ðɪs ˈrestərɑːnt ɪz mɔːr ɪkˈspensɪv ðæn ðæt wʌn bət ðə fuːd ɪz ˈbetər ænd ðə ˈsɜːrvɪs ɪz ðə best ɪn ðə ˈsɪti/
shadowing.koreanTip: 'than'은 약하게 '던'처럼 발음돼요. 'better'는 미국식에서 't'가 'd' 소리로 바뀌어 '베더'처럼 들려요.

roleplay.scenario: You are shopping with a friend and comparing products.

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: I think this one is ___ than that one.

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: I think this is the ___ choice because ___.

koreanErrors.errorExample: She is more tall than me.

koreanErrors.explanation: In standard English, 'different' is followed by 'from', not 'than'.

koreanErrors.errorExample: She is the most prettiest girl.
koreanErrors.explanation: Don't use 'most' with adjectives that already have -est.
koreanErrors.tip: 'most'와 '-est'를 동시에 쓰면 안 돼요. 둘 중 하나만 사용하세요.
